Hihi  new here and stumbled upon this group from the Amaze card video :)Wanted to get some insights from people who have linked Citibank Premiermiles to Amaze; my card is still currently on VISA  is there any cons of converting it to Mastercard just to pair it with Amaze?And to double confirm  so if I use Amaze overseas  CitiPM will register it as overseas spending even though Amaze will convert it into a SGD charge in the citibank bill transaction?Thanks!
Why use Citi PM and not Citi Rewards though?
I guess initial laziness as I've always been on CitiPM  and my parents' sub card is free. Citi rewards still have expiry right
Yeah no harm getting the CitiPm MC.Not sure for the fx conversion part. Would recommend CRMC though since 4mpd plus 5 years expiry

Just keep two of them. So you have 4x priority passes per year
That would be 2x of the annual fees? ðŸ˜… Trying to learn from ur video advice to use put most things into one card
Just waive using the hotline or message. Dont have to pay for citi card fees
Ah i see. Not sure if i split my stuff into 2 cards whether they will deem me as low spender and don't give fee waiver. But ok let me read more into the citi reward card. Thank you!

shouldnt be an issue. i called up citi last year to cancel my PM and they even offered me a small retention offer of $50. catch is that i need to keep my card for another 3 years(annual fee waived for this 3 years)
essentially free $50 just to keep their card for free
Oh wow ok  thanks for the tips
$50 for 3yrs....1 less caller to their hotline to waive fees...ðŸ¤£ðŸ˜…

keep in mind that there is an on-going strategy call credit-card churning.we all know that by now that it is 100% possible to waive fees. if fail  appeal and waive again. if can't waive  cancel then reapply another card for a sign-up bonus which usually worth up to 250sgd.banks will try to bait you to keep the card with small bonus like 50 or 10x5 sgd package but if you are here to churn  don't fall for it. just cancel and come back again!just imagine how many sign up bonus you can get...google it! quite fun :)
Any good CC for overseas spending? I am already have Amex  UOB one  UOB absolute and standard chartered Manhantan card.
Just top up youtrip through grabpay master using UOB Absolute. 1.7% cashback with no foreign currency conversion fee

dilemma.. citi's sign up rewards always seem to be the best compared to the rest of the banks
#dpocbc CS quite a tough nut to crack to waive cc AF. they see you dont spend on those cards  they also dont bother trying so in the end cancel also.
